scenarioDescription:
The WTS-2 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WTS-2 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.75 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WTS-2 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WTS-2 system


WTS-2 b

WTS-2 b was discovered by the United Kingdom Infrared Telescope observatory, in 2014-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WTS-2 b is 356.160 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WTS-2 b is 15.278 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WTS-2 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WTS-2, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the United Kingdom Infrared Telescope.
name: WTS-2 - System With 1 Exoplanet
